name: Ultimate Cheese Dip
author: Stan G.
summary: This cheese dip is easily the best that I've ever had, and being a college student I've had quite a lot. The only reason there are ever leftovers is because this dip is so delicious and filling. I recommend Mission® or On The Border® chips because this dip is rather thick and you need a durable chip that wont break off too easy!
ingredients: 1 (10 ounce) can diced tomatoes with green chile peppers (such as RO*TEL®), drained
1 (2 pound) loaf processed cheese (such as Velveeta®), cubed
directions: Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat
Cook and stir sausage, beef, and onion in the hot skillet until browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes; drain and discard grease
Transfer meat mixture to a large pot and add Cheddar cheese, tomatoes with green chile peppers, cream cheese, picante sauce, garlic powder, and cumin
Heat cheese mixture over medium-high heat
Gradually stir in processed cheese until cheese is melted, about 10 minutes
